data.prayer: Spirit, guide someone in the church in the state of Chiradzulu to a person ready to receive the message of the gospel, like Lydia, and who will then open her home to faith.
data.verse: One of those listening was a woman from the city of Thyatira named Lydia, a dealer in purple cloth. She was a worshiper of God. The Lord opened her heart to respond to Paul’s message.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Chiradzulu, Malawi
data.section_summary: What people or resources could you pray for in this photo?

data.prayer: Jesus, you said you were the giver of evangelists to the church. Please, send more evangelists to the state of Chiradzulu, Malawi.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up

data.label_1: One disciple of Jesus for every 5 lost neighbors

data.prayer: God, we ask you to raise up elders and deacons from the 272 believers in Chiradzulu, who will serve the church and equip it to do your work.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up until we all reach unity in the faith and in the knowledge of the Son of God and become mature, attaining to the whole measure of the fullness of Christ.

data.prayer: Jesus, help the church in the state of Chiradzulu to not rely on buildings or programs, but on your Spirit and the simple faithfulness of every believer.
Lord, Let your Kingdom come among the Swahili people. Let your will be done, as in heaven, so on earth.
Father, multiply brothers, sisters, and mothers to our spiritual family in Chiradzulu, Malawi.
data.verse: He replied to him, “Who is my mother, and who are my brothers?” Pointing to his disciples, he said, “Here are my mother and my brothers. For whoever does the will of my Father in heaven is my brother and sister and mother.”

data.prayer: Father, thank you that you will never abandon the church of Chiradzulu, Malawi.
data.verse: Be free from the love of money, content with such things as you have, for he has said, “I will in no way leave you, neither will I in any way forsake you.

data.prayer: Lord, let it be said of the 1,328 lost in Chiradzulu that you have called them out of darkness into your glorious light.
data.verse: But you are a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for God’s own possession, that you may proclaim the excellence of him who called you out of darkness into his marvelous light
